title: Quiz: FQE January 2023 Past Paper
description: Full Final Qualifying Examination from January 2023 covering MCQs, Short Answer, and Long Answer questions.

questions.question: Listed below are ways of conveying information to the waiting list except?

options.text: Nurse or physician sending list of patients to be added to the waiting list

questions.explanation: The waiting list is a mechanism for scheduling patients. Information is conveyed via referrals or direct requests, not by creating a card for 'every' patient indiscriminately.
questions.hint: Think about which method is too general and not specific to a waiting list request.

questions.question: There are different types of health records indices used and maintained in a health records department, these include the following except?
questions.explanation: Standard indices (Disease, Operation, Physician) facilitate research and retrieval. A 'waiting list' is a scheduling tool/register, not a primary index used for retrospective data retrieval.
questions.hint: Which one is used for scheduling rather than researching past cases?

questions.question: The following are checks to be made on the waiting list except?
questions.explanation: Administrative list maintenance focuses on Completeness, Accuracy, and De-duplication. 'Quality' is a broad clinical or service concept, not a specific clerical check on a list entry.
questions.hint: Three options refer to data integrity; one refers to a broader abstract concept.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a quality of a Health Records and Information Officer?
questions.explanation: Professional qualities include Integrity, Adaptability, and Discretion (Humility). Generosity is a personal virtue but not a professional requirement for records management.
questions.hint: Which trait is a personal kindness rather than a professional standard?

questions.question: The following are permanent records, which one is not?
questions.explanation: Registers (Birth, Death, Surgical) are statutory permanent records. Maternity records have a long retention period (e.g., 25 years) but are not classified as 'permanent' registers.
questions.hint: Distinguish between a patient case file and a statutory register.

questions.question: Case records can be stated as ____.

options.text: Records initiated for patients who got admitted into the wards and attend consultative clinics
Patients who continuously attend the consultant clinic
The person taking in the information
The range of documents to be included in the case records

questions.explanation: Case records cover the clinical history for both inpatient (ward) and outpatient (clinic) episodes.
questions.hint: Look for the definition that covers both admission and clinic attendance.

questions.question: The common tracer card has the following information written on it except?
questions.explanation: A tracer card needs to identify the file (Name/Number) and where it went (Destination/Date). Date of Birth is not critical for the temporary tracking function.
questions.hint: Which piece of information doesn't help locate where the file went?

questions.question: Auxiliary equipment includes the following except?
questions.explanation: Trolleys, ladders, and tables are auxiliary equipment. Dividers are filing supplies/consumables used within the system.
questions.hint: Which item is a supply placed inside the shelf rather than a tool used to do the work?

questions.question: The most economical filling method as far as space is concerned is?
questions.explanation: Mobile racking (Compactus) eliminates fixed aisles, saving up to 50% of floor space compared to static shelving.
questions.hint: Which system moves on rails to eliminate aisles?

questions.question: Which of the following principles in medical practice entitles patients equity and fairness?
questions.explanation: Justice refers to fairness, equity, and impartial distribution of resources.
questions.hint: Think of the legal term for fairness.

questions.question: Which of the following requirements is not to be considered when establishing a health records department?

options.text: System of communication within the department and other departments
System to ensure transportation of files within the department and other departments

questions.explanation: While important, specific file transportation systems are operational details. Location, Space, and Communication are fundamental strategic establishment requirements.
questions.hint: Which option is an operational logistical detail rather than a structural requirement?

questions.question: __________ is the arrangement of all forms inside the unit folder in a prescribed manner
questions.explanation: Editing (or assembly) involves checking and arranging the documents in a specific order (chronological or source-oriented) after discharge.
questions.hint: This process happens before permanent filing to tidy up the record.

questions.question: Health records are primarily used for?
questions.explanation: The primary purpose of the record is to document care for the patient's ongoing treatment (continuity). Research and billing are secondary uses.
questions.hint: What is the most immediate reason a doctor writes notes?

questions.question: Records are necessary for the practice of _________ as Medication and for effective treatment
questions.explanation: The full quote is: 'Records are necessary for the practice of Medicine as Medication is for effective treatment.'
questions.hint: Complete the sentence logically: Records help practice...

questions.question: Diagnostic records:

options.text: They include notes on Radiography, pathology and other investigations
They are usually initiated by consultative forms
These forms are usually 6" x 4" in size and are available in all morgue rooms
They are in-patient department in a health care facility

questions.explanation: Diagnostic records specifically refer to reports from diagnostic services like X-ray (radiography) and Labs (pathology).
questions.hint: Which department helps 'diagnose' through images and tests?

questions.question: ____ are the basic concepts and fundamental principles of decent human conduct?
questions.explanation: Ethics refers to moral principles of decent conduct. In a work setting, this is Professional Ethics.
questions.hint: It deals with right and wrong behavior in a profession.

questions.question: The first real physician of health records in Egypt is?
questions.explanation: Imhotep (c. 2600 BC) is the earliest known physician by name and is associated with the first systematic medical records in Egypt.
questions.hint: He was an Egyptian polymath and architect of the Step Pyramid.

questions.question: Hippocrates was known for the below mentioned except
questions.explanation: Hippocrates was a Greek physician. 'Grand Vizier' is a title associated with Ancient Egypt (Imhotep) or Ottoman officials, not Greek medicine.
questions.hint: Which title belongs to an Egyptian or Ottoman official, not a Greek doctor?

questions.question: Informal admission refers to?

options.text: A patient is admitted voluntarily, he or she is aware he has mental illness
A patient is admitted without legal or other formalities and the hospital has no right to detain him against his will
A patient is admitted with legal formalities

questions.explanation: Informal admission is voluntary. The key distinction is the patient is free to leave (no detention rights).
questions.hint: Think 'Voluntary' and 'No formalities'.

questions.question: Wide spread implementation of electronic records has been hampered by perceived barriers including one of the following
questions.explanation: Incompatibility (or lack of interoperability) between different systems is a major barrier. The others are positive outcomes.
questions.hint: Which one is a technical problem?

questions.question: One of the following statements in not true about subpoena

options.text: Is the term used for legal order to produce records to a court
It is usually addressed to the custodian of medical records
If a subpoena or court order is served it must not be obeyed
It directs the person to appear in a given court with the records

questions.explanation: A subpoena MUST be obeyed. Disobeying it leads to contempt of court.
questions.hint: Can you ignore a court order?

questions.question: The type of tracing system where the card may be used many times for multiple records is called?
questions.explanation: A common tracer card is generic and reusable for any file.
questions.hint: Which word implies it can be shared or used by all?

questions.question: Which of the following is a quality of a good appraiser?
questions.explanation: An appraiser needs Professional Judgment to evaluate the value of records for retention or destruction.
questions.hint: What specific mental skill is needed to make decisions about value?

questions.question: Which of the following is not an important step in determining the amount of space required for medical records files?

options.text: Measure of full shelf and count the number on the shelf
Calculate the number of files per linear meter
Estimate the number of personnel required
Estimate the number of outpatient registration, deaths and discharges

questions.explanation: Personnel numbers affect office space, not the physical storage capacity needed for the files themselves.
questions.hint: Which option relates to staff rather than physical file volume?

questions.question: The section where when patient arrives in health care facility is greeted and welcomed to the hospital,
questions.explanation: Reception is the initial greeting point.
questions.hint: Where do you first report upon arrival?

questions.question: There are different types of health records that are generated from medical facility and they are grouped into the following categories, which one is not?
questions.explanation: 'Patient records' is the umbrella term for all of them, not a specific sub-category like Case or Outpatient records.
questions.hint: Which term describes the whole group rather than a part?

questions.question: In the process of initiating a patient record, the following details must appear except
questions.explanation: While address is important, Name, Sex, and Date are critical for clinical identification on the sheet itself. Address is often stored in the registration system.
questions.hint: Which detail is demographic contact info rather than immediate identification?

questions.question: It is at the _______ that new patients/clients get their first impression of the institution values, neatness, cleanliness, taste and consideration for patient comfort
questions.explanation: The Reception is the 'face' of the hospital where first impressions are formed.
questions.hint: Where does the patient interaction begin?

questions.question: In terminal digit filing system, the growth is not at one end because?

options.text: It is the easier way of filling
It is used by the United States hospital
The library is divided into 100 major sections

questions.explanation: TDF distributes records evenly across 100 sections (00-99), preventing congestion at the end.
questions.hint: How many sections does Terminal Digit Filing use?

questions.question: Sources of admission include the following except?
questions.explanation: In-patient clinic is a contradictory term. Clinics are outpatient; Wards are inpatient.
questions.hint: Clinics are for outpatients, not inpatients.

questions.question: All offices should comply with precaution
questions.explanation: Fire precautions are mandatory safety requirements for all offices.
questions.hint: Think about safety emergencies.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a procedure for disposal of dead bodies?
questions.explanation: Examination (autopsy) is a medical procedure, not a final disposal method like Burial or Cremation.
questions.hint: Which one involves checking the body rather than final rest?

questions.question: The line of command in the department of health records must be
questions.explanation: The chain of command must be clearly specified so everyone knows who they report to.
questions.hint: It needs to be clearly defined.

questions.question: Ensure the gangway is at least _______ feet apart
questions.explanation: The standard minimum width for a gangway (aisle) is 3 feet to allow safe passage.
questions.hint: Standard aisle width.

questions.question: The section of the medical records department that arranges admission for emergency patients is called?
questions.explanation: The Bed Bureau manages bed occupancy and arranges admissions.
questions.hint: Which office manages the beds?

questions.question: The following are sources of appointments except?
questions.explanation: Appointments are initiated by patients or doctors. HRIOs process them but don't typically act as the 'source' of the clinical need for the appointment.
questions.hint: Who usually asks for the appointment?

questions.question: _____ is a document used for receiving goods from suppliers before storage
questions.explanation: In Kenyan government procurement, S 13 is the Goods Received Note (Counter Receipt Voucher).
questions.hint: S 11 is for issuing. Which one is for receiving?

questions.question: The following are goals of designing Medical Records forms except?

options.text: To provide guidance to form users
To improve the level of communication among health care providers
To reduce reproduction of many forms

questions.explanation: Reducing reproduction is a cost goal, not a primary design goal like usability, communication, or data efficiency.
questions.hint: Which option is about printing costs rather than form function?

questions.question: In strict alphabetical, surname, first name, Date of Birth (D.O.B) which of the following patients will be filed first in the master index?
questions.explanation: Alphabetical order: Odongo (same) -> Maryann (same) -> Adhiambo (comes before Akoth, Atieno, Ayoo).
questions.hint: Check the third name alphabetically.

questions.question: ________ consent arises when records are disclosed to another medical agency for purpose of confirmed treatment
questions.explanation: Implied consent is assumed for continuity of care between providers.
questions.hint: It is understood without being explicitly stated.

questions.question: Describe five ways of disposing patients attended to at the accident and emergency department
questions.explanation:
Ways of Disposing Patients at A&E:

  1. Admission: Admitted to ward for care.
  2. Discharge Home: Treated and sent home.
  3. Referral to Clinic: Given appointment for follow-up.
  4. Transfer: Sent to another hospital.
  5. Brought in Dead (BID) / Death: Moved to mortuary.
questions.hint: Think about where a patient can go after leaving the A&E room.

questions.question: Enumerate five Acts related to health records management
questions.explanation:
Key Acts:

  • Public Health Act (Cap 242)
  • Mental Health Act (Cap 248)
  • Medical Practitioners and Dentists Act (Cap 253)
  • Data Protection Act
  • Public Archives and Documentation Service Act
  • Evidence Act
questions.hint: List 5 laws governing health info in Kenya.

questions.question: State five importance of quality assurance and quality improvement
questions.explanation:
Importance of QA:

  1. Improved Patient Safety
  2. Enhanced Efficiency
  3. Standardization of care
  4. Cost Reduction
  5. Better Clinical Outcomes
  6. Compliance with standards
questions.hint: Why do we check quality?

questions.question: Identify five responsibilities of medical records committee
questions.explanation:
Responsibilities:

  1. Policy Formulation
  2. Quality Review/Audit
  3. Form Design & Control
  4. Retention & Disposal decisions
  5. Standardization of coding
questions.hint: What does the committee decide on?

questions.question: Who are the members of the medical records committee?
questions.explanation:
Members:

  • Medical Superintendent (Chair)
  • HRIO (Secretary)
  • Nursing Officer (Matron)
  • Clinicians/Consultants
  • Hospital Administrator
questions.hint: List the job titles of the committee members.

questions.question: What are the benefits of electronic medical records?
questions.explanation:
Benefits:

  1. Accessibility (Multiple users)
  2. Storage Efficiency (Less space)
  3. Fast Retrieval
  4. Legibility (No handwriting errors)
  5. Clinical Decision Support
  6. Data Backup & Security
questions.hint: Why is a computer better than paper?

questions.question: Enumerate five advantages of terminal digit filling
questions.explanation:
Advantages:

  1. Even distribution of files
  2. Balanced workflow
  3. Reduced misfiling
  4. Scalability (Unlimited growth)
  5. Security (Files scattered)
questions.hint: Why use TDF over serial numbering?

questions.question: Identify five causes of problems affecting quality in health care delivery
questions.explanation:
Causes:

  1. Inadequate Staffing
  2. Lack of Resources/Equipment
  3. Poor Communication
  4. Inadequate Training
  5. Poor Documentation
  6. Lack of Leadership
questions.hint: What makes hospital quality bad?

questions.question: Explain the procedure of admitting a patient to the hospital (Long Answer)
questions.explanation:
Admission Procedure:

  1. Authorization: Doctor signs admission order.
  2. Reception: Check MPI for previous file.
  3. Data Collection: Register new/update old patient details.
  4. Documentation: Prepare file with forms.
  5. Financial: Clear insurance/payment.
  6. Bed Allocation: Bed Bureau assigns bed.
  7. Registers: Update Admission Register.
  8. Escort: Patient taken to ward.
questions.hint: Walk through the steps from the doctor saying 'admit' to the patient arriving in the bed.
